intro: Tsimatimia pedicellata, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a species of orchid native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), and it produces fragrant blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
